fields.name: Qorii
fields.description: Qorii is a traditional wooden container used for food storage and serving.

fields.name: Madiba Shirt
fields.description: A distinctive patterned shirt made popular by Nelson Mandela, symbolizing pride and unity.

fields.name: Ndebele Beaded Aprons
fields.description: A vibrant apron decorated with intricate beadwork, part of Ndebele cultural attire.

fields.name: Zulu Shield and Spear
fields.description: A traditional Zulu shield and spear set, symbolizing strength, protection, and heritage.

fields.name: African Drum
fields.description: A handcrafted African drum, perfect for music, rhythm practice, and cultural celebrations.

fields.name: Kente Cloth
fields.description: A vibrant, multicolored hand-loomed fabric with symbolic meanings, worn by the Ashanti and Ewe people of Ghana.

fields.name: Shuka (Kenya/Tanzania)
fields.description: A brightly colored, checkered cloth worn by the Maasai. Often red, it is wrapped around the body.

fields.name: Kanzu (Uganda/Tanzania)
fields.description: A white or cream-colored robe traditionally worn by men, especially among Swahili-speaking communities.

fields.name: Habesha Kemis (Ethiopia)
fields.description: A hand-woven cotton dress with intricate embroidery, worn by Habesha women during cultural and religious events.

fields.name: Gomesi (Uganda)
fields.description: A brightly colored floor-length dress with pointed shoulders, traditionally worn by women in Uganda.

fields.name: Agbada (Nigeria)
fields.description: A large, flowing robe worn by Yoruba men for weddings, festivals, and special occasions.

fields.name: Dashiki (West Africa)
fields.description: A colorful, V-shaped embroidered tunic worn by both men and women across West Africa.

fields.name: Boubou (Senegal/Mali)
fields.description: A flowing robe worn by both men and women across West Africa, symbolizing elegance and tradition.

fields.name: Bògòlanfini (Mali)
fields.description: Also known as mudcloth, this hand-woven cotton fabric is dyed with fermented mud to create symbolic designs.

fields.name: Liputa (DRC)
fields.description: A vibrant four-piece ensemble of matching fabric, traditionally worn by Congolese women.

fields.name: Djellaba (Morocco)
fields.description: A long, loose-fitting robe with a hood, commonly worn by both men and women in Morocco.
